meanings.sent1: We need to presettle the meeting time before everyone gets busy.
meanings.sent2: Let's presettle the issue so we can avoid any conflicts later on.
meanings.sent3: I presettle my outfit choices the night before to save time in the morning.
meanings.sent4: She presettled her doubts and fears, allowing her to face the challenge with confidence.
meanings.sent5: Presettling the rules early on can prevent misunderstandings later.

meanings.definition: To establish or decide in advance
meanings.sent1: They presettle the menu for the party to ensure everyone's preferences are considered.
meanings.sent2: It's important to presettle the budget before starting the project.
meanings.sent3: He likes to presettle his travel plans to avoid last-minute stress.
meanings.sent4: The team presettled the roles and responsibilities to work efficiently together.
meanings.sent5: Presettling the terms of the agreement can prevent disagreements in the future.

meanings.definition: To make arrangements or preparations before an event or situation
meanings.sent1: We should presettle the accommodation for our trip to avoid any last-minute issues.
meanings.sent2: She presettled the equipment needed for the presentation to ensure a smooth delivery.
meanings.sent3: The family decided to presettle the holiday plans to make the most of their time together.
meanings.sent4: Presettling the logistics will help us focus on the main tasks during the event.
meanings.sent5: He presettled the schedule to make sure everything runs according to plan.
